cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles southwest of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then forecast to bend northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend and the southeast United States

weather_observation.watch_coast: Suwannee River to Anna Maria Island FL, including Tampa Bay (TS Watch); Navarre FL to Anna Maria Island FL including Tampa Bay (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along west-central Florida as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from the Tampa Bay area northward through the Florida Panhandle and Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (30–45 mph with higher gusts) are possible Tuesday night through Wednesday as the center passes well northwest of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in and near Tampa Bay, including the Manatee County Port area, beginning late Tuesday and peaking Wednesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals around 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts; brief flash flooding possible but widespread flooding not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas will disrupt vessel operations in Tampa Bay and coastal approaches.
